title: NBA Face Off
description: Turning NBA player statistics into a card game. NBA Face Off is a multiplayer, web-based card game designed around real-time NBA player statistics. Developed using React, Apollo GraphQL, AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, Serverless, and Python.
description_long: Inspired by card games like Top Trumps, NBA Face Off, is a web-based card game where players can connect with friends around the world and go head to head in a battle of luck and NBA player knowledge. Using real statistics for the past season of the NBA queried from the nba_api, players compete to take all their opponent's cards by choosing a game statistic which they think their player performed better at than their opponent.
motivations:
Growing up, I could never dribble, shoot and throw passes across the court so it never occurred to me that it would be fun watching other people do it for a living.

I followed e-sports occasionally and loved competing in rock climbing competitions, but it was only after getting sucked into the career of Michael Jordan in The Last Dance during the Christmas of my first year at UBC did I start to see how the narratives of sports can be so captivating.

Since then, following the NBA and learning about different stars and eras has become a big hobby of mine. I love basketball, my friends love basketball and after watching friends obsess over player stats in their fantasy league, I thought it would be fun to turn that obsession with stats into its own game.
features: Dynamic user interface built with React and Tailwind
Realtime game updates enabled by websocket connections
Internal Apollo GraphQL API for reading and modifying database of game states
Cloud-hosted database of up-to-date player statistics updated regularly with AWS lambda functions

timeline.body: Came up with project idea: "Top Trumps but for NBA Player Stats"
First commit: developing AWS Lambda function for fetching player data
Basic game UI designed in Figma and implemented with React and Tailwind
Development of GraphQL reducers for managing game state in DynamoDB database
Main game logic implemented and first prototype locally tested with friends
First deployment of game via Railway and first online test game with friends

title: Panda Path
description: Providing peace of mind to Vancouver commuters. Panda Path is a mobile application that uses VPD crime data to help users safely get where they want to go. This full-stack project was built with MongoDB and ExpressJS for the backend and React Native for the frontend.
description_long: Built with three friends at StormHacks 2023, Panda Path is a iOS and Android app built with React Native that helps people safely get where they want to go. After entering their destination, users are shown the path that avoids areas thought to be dangerous according to Vancouver Police crime data. Working on the app's backend, I designed and implemented the REST API for managing authentication and user data using Express JS, JSON Web Tokens. Collaborating with the designers on our team, I then worked on turning our design into a dynamic frontend with React Native.
motivations: A common concern we identified among students going to school in a new city is the fear of ending up in a dangerous part of town while getting around. Our solution was to use Vancouver Police Department crime data to highlight dangerous areas and generate optimal walking paths that avoid those areas. Over 24 hours, we worked through the night to deliver on our idea and this is what we ended up with.
features: Cross-platform app built with React Native and CSS
REST API for accessing user data built in Express
User access secured using bcrypt encryption and JSON Web Tokens
Path generation and visualisation with the Google Maps Platform API
Database of user data and preferences hosted with MongoDB Atlas

timeline.body: 24hr countdown begins. Delegation and planning commences
After a long night with many problems and little sleep, submission is in!

title: Project Panini
description: Leveraging LLMs to help users come up with their next project idea. Project Panini uses the OpenAI API to turn user interests into full-fledged project ideas. Built with React.
description_long: Project Panini a React-based web app that helps developers come up with their next great project idea. We came up with the idea as part of nwHacks 2023 and worked tirelessly through the night to deliver a search-engine-like interface that turns user-entered keywords into fully fledged project ideas. After settling on an idea they like, users can add projects to their dashboard of ongoing projects and plan what they need to work on to get their project to completion.
motivations: Inspired by the proliferation of LLM powered applications, our team tried to solve a problem faced by many of our peers in computer science: coming up with exciting project ideas to work on and push forward their programming knowledge.
features: Dynamic user interface powered by React
GPT-3 powered project suggestions unique to your interests
User dashboard for centrally managing project ideas

timeline.body: The hackathon kicks off with some brainstorming and planning.
After a long day of coding, we have a functioning unpolished prototype.
The project is in! Time to get some sleep.
